channel.title: Finite Element Method on Datumorphism
channel.description: Recent content in Finite Element Method on Datumorphism

item.title: Finite Element Method
item.description: Differential Equations and Boundary Conditions Two Types of Boundary Conditions As an example, we have a partial differential equation $$ \frac{d^2u}{dx^2} + f = 0, $$ which describes a 1D problem. Dirichlet boundary condition: specify values for $u$, such as $u(0)=u_0$ and $u(L)=u_L$; Neumann boundary condition: specifiy values for $u_{,x}$. If we have only Neumann boundary condition, the solution is not unique. One example for it is tossing a bar, which can have both Neumann BC at both ends but it is moving. Example Problems Elasticity Problem We consider the displacement $u(x)$ at each space coordinate $x$ of a elastic bar under some external force.
